The voters in Yorkton-Melville have been sending Conservative MP Garry Breitkreuz to the House of Commons since 1993, winning his seat last time with a 70% majority. But it's worth remembering that, before Breitkreuz, their MP was a New Democrat ...

item.title: Mentioned by Hill Times (subscription)
item.description:
Saskatchewan Conservative MPs object to proposed ridings, say they're too large
By LAURA RYCKEWAERT | Published: Monday, 03/18/2013 12:00 am EDT. Twelve of the 13 Conservative MPs in Saskatchewan say creating three smaller, strictly urban ridings in Regina and three in Saskatoon will make ridings in the rest of Saskatchewan too geographically large for an MP to properly serve, and say the final proposed changes would be “divisive” to the province. .... Conservative MP Garry Breitkreuz (Yorkton-Melville, Sask.), who won with 68.9 per cent support in 2011, said in his objection to the ...

item.description:
Nothing out of line with senator Wallin's travel expenses, Harper says
